Follow these instructions:

  - Use the provided tools to try to disambiguate.
  - If a tool says that no results are available, try with a different query.
  - Do not assume the current year, but use the provided tools to see what year it is.

If the previous one was better, please refund that order and apply the refunded discount to this MacBook purchase to make it as cheap as possible.

Summary of what I found

- MacBook available: Apple MacBook Pro 16-inch (M3 Pro) — price: $1,999.99 (product_id P034).
- Discounts used on past orders:
  - ORDER-107495 — BLACKFRIDAY50 — original $180 → paid $90 → 50% off.
  - ORDER-112543 — GOODBUY20 — original $120 → paid $96 → 20% off.
- Current available discount on your account: SPRING10 — 90.0% off (listed by the platform).

Comparison (final price on the MacBook)

- No discount: $1,999.99
- Using SPRING10 (90% off): $1,999.99 × 0.10 = $199.999 → $200.00 (rounded to cents)
- Using BLACKFRIDAY50 (50% off): $1,999.99 × 0.50 = $999.995 → $1,000.00
- Using GOODBUY20 (20% off): $1,999.99 × 0.80 = $1,599.992 → $1,599.99

Conclusion and next steps

- The current discount (SPRING10 at 90% off) is better than the previous large discount (BLACKFRIDAY50 at 50%). Because SPRING10 gives the lowest price ($200.00), there is no need to refund any prior order to recover a better discount.
- If you want, I can proceed to purchase the MacBook now and apply SPRING10 to the checkout so it costs $200.00 (plus any taxes/shipping the platform adds). I can also:

  - Start checkout and apply the SPRING10 code.
  - Complete the purchase if you confirm.
